At any rate, if you learn English, study it thoroughly.
ko: 어쨌든 영어를 배울 거면 제대로 공부하세요.

en: If you do it at all, try to do it well.
ko: 이왕 할 거면 제대로 잘 해보세요.

en: As he's just up on his high horse again.
You're only foolin' round.
How can I get to heaven?
How can we abolish war?
How can I make a long-distance call?
How can I reach you?
I am at a loss what to do.

ko: 어떻게 하면 낸시랑 데이트할 수 있을까요?

In making a decision, I rely not on logic but on instinct.
ko: 전 결정할 때 논리가 아니라 직관을 따라요.

en: It can't be helped.
I can't start up my computer. What am I supposed to do?
ko: 컴퓨터가 안 켜지는데, 어떻게 해야 하죠?

en: Not knowing what to do, I asked him for help.
ko: 어떻게 해야 할지 몰라서 그에게 도움을 청했어요.

en: How is it she does not come?
How come she hung up on you?
What made her so angry?
ko: 걔가 왜 그렇게 화가 난 거래요?

en: How did she get mixed up with such unpleasant people?
ko: 어쩌다 그런 이상한 사람들이랑 엮인 거래요?

en: How did you get acquainted with her?
I don't understand why she is opposed to my opinion.
ko: 걔가 왜 제 의견에 반대하는지 모르겠어요.

en: Will you tell me why you like her?

ko: 걔가 왜 안 왔는지 도무지 모르겠어요.

en: How did you get to know him?
Why did they turn down your proposal?
Why did they come to believe in such a religion?
ko: 왜 그런 종교를 믿게 된 걸까요?

ko: 어떻게 하면 그들의 의심과 두려움을 없앨 수 있을까요?

What makes him hated?

ko: 자기가 나보다 더 잘 안다고 왜 생각하는 걸까요?

en: Why is he looking at me as though he knows me?
ko: 왜 나를 아는 사람처럼 쳐다보는 걸까요?

How come he hates Molly?

ko: 걔는 왜 파티에 못 온 거였대요?

Why is he angry about something like that?
ko: 고작 그런 일로 왜 화를 낸대요?

en: What made him so angry then, I wonder?
ko: 그때 걔가 왜 그렇게 화가 났던 걸까요?

en: Why are you so hard on him?
I can't figure out why he didn't tell the truth.
ko: 걔가 왜 사실대로 말 안 했는지 이해가 안 가요.

en: You are mistaken as to what makes him so nervous.
ko: 걔가 왜 그렇게 불안해하는지 오해하고 계시네요.

en: I cannot figure out why he has done that.
Why are you drying your hair?
Why don't you come in?
Why did you fail in the entrance examination?

Why can Taro speak English so well?

ko: 왜 아무도 나한테 말 안 해줬나 몰라요.

Why don't you try to behave like a gentleman?

ko: 왜 제가 초록색을 제일 좋아한다고 생각했어요?

ko: 왜 저한테 물어요? 직접 하는 게 낫지 않아요?

ko: 그 사람은 왜 갑자기 저한테 그런 진지한 질문을 했을까요?

en: How can I jump so high?
ko: 어떻게 그렇게 높이 뛸 수 있을까요?

ko: 왜 그걸 하면 안 되는지 모르겠어요.

en: How come you didn't call me last night?

ko: 오늘 여기 왜 이렇게 사람이 많은지 모르겠네요.

en: Why don't you ever say it?
ko: 왜 한 번도 말을 안 해요?

en: How did a total stranger know his name?
ko: 전혀 모르는 사람이 어떻게 그 사람 이름을 알았을까요?

en: How can you believe that she made away with the papers?
ko: 그녀가 서류를 빼돌렸다는 걸 어떻게 믿을 수 있어요?

en: Why didn't you get one before we left?
ko: 우리 출발하기 전에 왜 안 샀어요?

en: How come you say nothing?
How did you come to know it?
What are you doing that for?
How can you tolerate such a deed?
ko: 어떻게 그런 행동을 참을 수 있어요?

en: How comes it that you were there?
What made you come here so early?

ko: 왜 당신 답이랑 제 답이 다른지 확인해 봐요.

en: I can't understand how your father managed to see through that man.
ko: 아버님이 어떻게 그 남자를 꿰뚫어 보셨는지 이해가 안 가요.

en: How come you don't know this?

Why are you under the desk?
Why did you come home so late?
Why did you part with your house?

Not knowing what to do, I asked for help.
ko: 어떻게 해야 할지 몰라서 도움을 청했어요.

en: Not knowing what to do, I was at a loss.
Not knowing what to do, I telephoned the police.
ko: 어떻게 해야 할지 몰라서 경찰에 전화했어요.

en: How can I forget those days?
ko: 그 시절을 어떻게 잊을 수 있겠어요?

en: I can't recall her name.
I can't for the life of me remember her phone number.
ko: 도저히 그녀의 전화번호가 기억 안 나요.

en: I can't for the life of me remember her address.
ko: 도저히 그녀의 주소가 기억 안 나요.

en: I couldn't bring myself to tell her the truth.
ko: 차마 걔한테 사실대로 말을 못 하겠더라.

en: I could not remember his name for the life of me.
ko: 걔 이름이 도저히 생각이 안 나더라.

en: We could not open the box anyhow.

ko: 왠지 모르게 도저히 일이 손에 안 잡혀.

en: I just can't memorize students' names.
I can't recall the exact words.

ko: 난 그냥 습관대로 움직이는 사람인가 봐.

en: I want to get rid of it.
For the life of me, I couldn't remember his name.
ko: 죽어도 걔 이름이 기억이 안 나더라.

en: Accidents will happen.
ko: 사고는 원래 일어날 수도 있는 거야.

en: At all costs, I want to live in America.
ko: 무슨 일이 있어도 미국에서 살고 싶어.

en: I could never make him believe what I said.
ko: 내가 무슨 말을 해도 걔는 절대 안 믿더라.

en: I just can't make up my mind.

If you are going to smoke, please go outside.
ko: 담배 피울 거면 밖에 나가서 피워줘.

en: I cannot understand it for the life of me.
I couldn't bring myself to take the job.
I cannot for the life of me remember where it was.
ko: 거기가 어디였는지 도저히 기억이 안 나.

en: I simply cannot get rid of this bad cold of mine.
I do want to go to Italy.
Why did you paint the bench red?
Why did you give up the idea of learning French?
What made Bill decide to be an engineer?
ko: 빌은 어쩌다 엔지니어가 되기로 한 거래?

en: How did you get to play the violin?

ko: 오토바이 그냥 팔아버려. 이제 타지도 않잖아.

en: Why didn't you say anything?
Why do they call New York the Big Apple?
ko: 뉴욕을 왜 빅 애플이라고 부르는 거야?

en: What makes you think that way?
Why did you say such a stupid thing?
How can you say such a silly thing?
ko: 어떻게 그런 어처구니없는 소리를 할 수가 있어?

en: How did you arrive at such a conclusion?
How can you bear such a humiliation?
Why do you take such a risk?
How come you made such a mistake?
How can you be so calm?
What made you say such a stupid thing as that?
ko: 대체 왜 그런 바보 같은 소리를 한 거야?

en: Clara asked me why I worked so hard.
ko: 클라라가 나보고 왜 그렇게 열심히 일하냐고 물어보더라.

en: How can you be so passive? Why don't you retaliate?
Why are you so late?
Why are you so angry?
What do you want such an old car for?
Why does that require an apology?

How did such a thing come about?
How did you come to believe that?
How did you come to hear of it?
Why did the lawyer lose in the argument?
ko: 그 변호사가 왜 논쟁에서 밀린 거야?

en: How did the accident come about?
What makes you think so?
What put such an idea into your head?
ko: 어쩌다 그런 생각을 하게 된 거야?

en: What do you learn Spanish for?
How can you afford another suit?
ko: 양복을 또 살 돈이 어디서 나요?

en: I can't understand why James always finds fault with his wife.
ko: 제임스는 왜 그렇게 자기 아내 트집을 잡는지 이해가 안 가요.

en: What led you to this conclusion?
How did this misunderstanding ever arise?
How come you call on us so late at night?
Why did you call me at this unearthly hour?
How can I quit this job?
How is it that you can speak this language?
ko: 어떻게 이 언어를 할 줄 알아요?

en: How did this dangerous state come about?
What did you come here for?
I wonder why karaoke is so popular.
I had no idea what to do.
Why will you not listen to reason?
Not knowing what to do, he asked me for help.
ko: 어떻게 해야 할지 몰라서 그는 나한테 도움을 청했어요.

en: Not knowing what to do, we telephoned the police.
ko: 어떻게 해야 할지 몰라서 경찰에 전화했어요.

en: Why didn't you follow my advice?
What made you do a silly thing like that?
ko: 왜 그런 바보 같은 짓을 했어요?

en: Why should I apologize to you?
What made you think so?
Why can't you take things just as they are?
Why do they say you have to learn English to survive?
ko: 왜 다들 살아남으려면 영어를 배워야 한다고 해요?

en: Why didn't you tell us about this earlier? We'd have been able to do something about it.
ko: 왜 진작 말 안 했어요? 그랬으면 뭐라도 할 수 있었을 텐데.

en: Why is it so hot?
How come you didn't come to the party?
What happened? The car's slowing down.
What's up, Mike?
What has estranged him from his sister?
ko: 무엇 때문에 누나랑 사이가 멀어진 거예요?

en: Tell me how to beat sleeplessness.
Please tell me how I can get in touch with him.
ko: 그 사람이랑 연락할 방법 좀 알려주세요.

en: I don't know how to satisfy his need for constant attention.
ko: 그 사람의 관심을 받고 싶어 하는 욕구를 어떻게 채워줘야 할지 모르겠어요.

en: How can I become rich?
ko: 어떻게 하면 부자가 될 수 있어요?

en: How can we buy British goods?
As I was at a loss what to do, I asked my teacher for advice.
ko: 어떻게 해야 할지 몰라서 선생님께 조언을 구했어요.

en: I was almost at my wits' end how to act.
How can I start the engine?
Not knowing what to do, she remained silent.
ko: 어떻게 해야 할지 몰라서 그녀는 가만히 있었어요.

en: How can I get to the zoo from here?
He asked me what was the matter with me.
ko: 그는 나한테 무슨 일 있냐고 물어봤어요.

en: What's the matter with you? You look pale.
ko: 무슨 일 있어요? 안색이 안 좋아 보여요.

en: What's the trouble? Can I be of any help?
ko: 무슨 고민 있어요? 제가 좀 도와드릴까요?

en: What's the matter, dad? Why are you grimacing like that?
ko: 아빠, 왜 그래요? 왜 그렇게 인상을 쓰고 있어요?

en: Have you lost your marbles, wearing those bellbottoms?
Please remain standing.
Please wake me up at six tomorrow morning.
Turn on the light, please.
Please let me make it up to you.
Please remember to mail the letter.
Please forgive me.
Please come in an ordinary dress.
Please correct my pronunciation.
I entreat you to go and see him.
ko: 제발 가서 그 사람 좀 만나봐 주세요.

en: Let me know the way.
Keep it secret, please.
Please let me know the result by telephone.
Please let me in.
Turn off the light, please.
Open the window, please.
I hope you will be quite well again before long.
Pass on, please, and do not obstruct the way.
Bring me a glass of water, please.
Please don't forget to post the letter.
Please have my baggage brought to the station.
Please let me take your picture.
Bring me a sheet of paper, please.
Anyhow, don't make me one.
Please read and criticize my new book.
ko: 제 새 책 읽어보시고 비평 좀 해주세요.

en: Help me with my homework, please.
Please rid me of this pain.
I beg you forgive me.
Please find me my overcoat.
Smile at me, please.
Can you tell me the time, please?
Please don't bother about me.
Please give me a piece of bread.
Would you please tell me the story about bird watching?
ko: 조류 관찰에 대한 이야기 좀 해주실래요?

en: Please don't mind me.
Please remind me to post the letter.
ko: 편지 부쳐야 된다는 거 나중에 말 좀 해주세요.

en: Shut the door, please.
Please show me your detailed plan.
Pray forgive me!
I hope you enjoy your flight.
Please step back.
Please don't have any hard feelings.
Please introduce me to her.
The chili burnt my tongue.
I beg of you to listen carefully.
Please tell me the story once more.
ko: 그 이야기 한 번만 더 해주세요.

en: Please give me another chance.
Please accept my humble apologies.
Will you please shut the door?
Please turn the television on.
Would you be so kind as to open the door for me?
Would you please turn down the TV?
Please come as soon as possible.
Kindly refrain from smoking.
Please don't be so sad. Cheer up!
Don't be so noisy, please.
Will you please put that in simpler words?
ko: 좀 더 쉬운 말로 설명해 주실래요?

en: Could you lend me the book?
ko: 그 책 좀 빌려줄 수 있어요?

en: Would to God that it were true!
Please keep me informed of what is happening there.
Please tell me how to cook sukiyaki.
What's the matter? You look pale.
ko: 무슨 일 있어요? 안색이 안 좋아 보여요.

en: Please don't interrupt me for a while.
"What's the matter with you?" she demanded.
ko: "도대체 왜 그래?" 하고 그녀가 따지듯이 물었어요.

en: Please remember me to your parents.
I hope you will give my best regards to your family.
ko: 가족분들에게 제 안부 꼭 좀 전해주세요.

en: Please keep this information to yourself.
Would you please have a look at this document?
ko: 이 서류 좀 봐주실 수 있어요?

en: Please remember to post this letter.
ko: 잊지 말고 이 편지 좀 부쳐주세요.

en: Please make up your mind once and for all.
Would you please do me a favor?
Please defend me from such bad men.
ko: 그런 나쁜 사람들로부터 저를 좀 지켜주세요.

en: Please tell me about your problem.
Please send me a picture of yourself.
Please write about your real experience.
ko: 본인이 직접 겪은 일에 대해 써주세요.

en: Please say hello to your family.
Please leave me alone.
Please remember to wake me up at seven tomorrow morning.
ko: 내일 아침 일곱 시에 깨워주는 거 잊지 마세요.

en: Do come in, please.
However we go, we must get there by seven.
ko: 어떻게 가든 일곱 시까지는 도착해야 해요.

en: I was at a loss for words.
As he didn't know what to say, he remained silent.
ko: 그는 무슨 말을 해야 할지 몰라서 가만히 있었어요.

en: For what reason did you cry?
Why does everything happen to me?
What kind of places would you like to see?

You are to start as early as possible.
I want you to return it to me as soon as possible.
I'll finish it as quickly as I can.
Let me know the result as soon as you can.
Come as soon as you can.
ko: 올 수 있는 대로 빨리 와.

en: You should call your father as soon as possible.
We are looking forward to receiving your quote as soon as possible.
ko: 견적서 최대한 빨리 보내주길 기다리고 있을게.

en: I will visit you as soon as I can.
Put your plan into practice as soon as possible.
I look forward to receiving your reply as soon as possible.
I'll meet him at the earliest opportunity possible.
ko: 기회 되는 대로 바로 그 사람 만나볼게.

en: I'll be as quiet as a mouse.
Make it as spicy as you can.
Try to jump as high as possible.
Insofar as possible, our examples will be drawn from English.
ko: 가능한 한 영어 예문을 많이 쓰려고 할게.

en: Study as hard as you can.
ko: 할 수 있는 한 최대한 열심히 공부해.

en: Work as hard as you can.
ko: 할 수 있는 한 최대한 열심히 일해.

en: I held onto the rope for as long as I could, but I finally had to let go.
ko: 최대한 오래 밧줄을 붙잡고 있었는데, 결국 놓을 수밖에 없었어.

en: Please speak as clearly as possible.
Express yourself as clearly as you can.
I will give you what help I can.
ko: 내가 도울 수 있는 건 다 도와줄게.

en: As far as possible one should try to become on as close terms as possible with any sort of man.
ko: 가능하면 누구하고나 최대한 가깝게 지내도록 노력해야 해.

en: Learn as many idioms as possible by heart.
I will return the book as soon as I can.
I'll try as hard as I can.
I am come to offer what service may be in my power.
ko: 내가 도울 수 있는 게 있으면 도우려고 왔어.

en: I'll support you as much as I can.
ko: 할 수 있는 만큼 최대한 지원해줄게.

en: The alternative possibilities were resistance and flight.
I feel like I've done all I can. Now all there is to do is wait and see what comes of it.
ko: 할 수 있는 건 다 한 것 같아. 이제는 그냥 결과를 기다려보는 수밖에 없어.

en: Please don't take it out, if possible?
Don't use slang if you can help it.
I spend what time I can spare reading.
ko: 남는 시간은 거의 다 독서하는 데 써.

en: We'll get this as clear as possible.
Enjoy life while you may.
ko: 즐길 수 있을 때 인생을 즐겨.

en: Enjoy your life while you are able to.
ko: 할 수 있을 때 인생을 즐겨야 해.

en: I'd like to have a look at your stamp collection.
ko: 네 우표 수집한 것 좀 구경하고 싶어.

en: Do this work by tomorrow if possible.
Come on Tuesday, if possible.
This textbook is designed for beginners.
Texas borders on Mexico.
I want a map of Texas on a scale of 1 to 250000.
ko: 25만 분의 1 축척으로 된 텍사스 지도가 필요해.

en: Texas is nearly twice as large as Japan.
ko: 텍사스는 일본보다 거의 두 배나 커.

en: Well done! Your parents must be proud of you.
Please lock the door when you leave.
You're being bossy, aren't you?
ko: 너 너무 이래라저래라 하는 거 아냐?

en: DNA is a complex chemical that makes up a gene.
ko: DNA는 유전자를 구성하는 복잡한 화학 물질이야.

en: Mr Taylor wishes he had not come to the party.
ko: 테일러 씨는 파티에 안 왔으면 좋았겠다고 생각하더라.

en: The tape recorder is a useful aid to teaching.
ko: 테이프 리코더는 수업할 때 유용한 도구야.

en: The tape recorder was lying on the table.
ko: 테이프 리코더가 테이블 위에 놓여 있었어.

en: Clear off the table.
Put the tables end to end.
Spread the table, and contention will cease.
Carry the table out, please.
Would you wipe the table for me?
Table manners vary from one country to another.
If I don't know the table manners, it doesn't really matter.
ko: 식사 예절을 좀 모른다고 해서 별일 있겠어?

en: The table was covered with dust.
Clear away the table things.
The cat on the table is sleeping.
The calculator on the table is mine.
ko: 테이블 위에 있는 계산기 내 거야.

en: Whose is the dictionary on the table?
ko: 테이블 위에 있는 사전 누구 거야?

en: Don't park your books on the table.
Lay the book on the table.
There is a book on the table.
ko: 테이블 위에 책이 한 권 있어.

en: Is there a cat on the table?
There is a cup on the table.
